interface.name: Context
interface.desc: The context object for each request.
interface.prop: To bypass Koa's built-in response handling, you may explicitly set `ctx.respond = false;`
The recommended namespace for passing information through middleware and to your frontend views.
interface.fn: `util.inspect()` implementation, which just returns the JSON output.
The value the presence of which to assert on. The error status code. The error message. The error properties. Similar to .throw(), adds assertion. ```js ctx.assert(ctx.user, 401, 'Please login!') ```

The status code as number. The message. By default, will look up in the status code table. Additional custom properties to attach to object. Throw an error with `msg` and optional `status` defaulting to 500. Note that these are user-level errors, and the message may be exposed to the client.
interface.prop: The reference to the request instance.
The reference to the response instance.
